CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1955, pg. 26 reads: "At School Science Fair - Under the guidance of Mrs. Lois Golden and Donald Edmonds, science teachers at Herron Hill Junior High School, five youngsters competed in recent School Science Fair, now on display at Buhl Planetarium. Robert Wooling and Bernard Scott are shown with their exhibit, "How to Make a Magnetic Compass," in the above photo.   Another project, "An Indoor Vegetable Garden," was exhibited by Daryl Gloster, Donna Youngblood and Diana Kendricks.  The 8-B students competed with over 1,000 other youngsters from Pittsburgh schools. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Robert Wooling and Bernard Scott, standing next to table with display that reads "Making a Magnetic Compass," during Herron Hill Junior High science fair
